definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: Foreign Minister Li Zhaoxing and other officials were present at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 外交部长李肇星等会见时在座。

sentences.english: Counselor Yao Wenliang and Consul Li Zhuang from the Chinese Consulate General were present.
sentences.chinese: 使馆参赞尧文良和领事李壮等在座。

sentences.english: You would never think ofpouring tea for yourself until you had poured it for everyone else at thetable.
sentences.chinese: 为在座的所有其他人倒茶之后，你才能为自己倒茶。

sentences.english: I'm grateful for your hospitality and the hospitality of the people of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 我对在座的各位和埃及人民的热情款待万分感激。

sentences.english: Many --Some of you may have seen this.
sentences.chinese: 在座可能已经有人看过。

sentences.english: But mainly must depend upon young compatriots who presents to take the main army.
sentences.chinese: 但主要还得依靠在座的年青宗长作为主力军。

sentences.english: Does anybody here have any food aversions?
sentences.chinese: 在座有人患有食物厌恶吗？

sentences.english: Chen Haosu, Chairman of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, was present at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 对外友协会长陈昊苏会见时在座。

sentences.english: Some proportion of people in this room have phobias.
sentences.chinese: 在座一定有人是恐惧症患者。

sentences.english: The wells of the brass double-inkstand danced in their sockets.
sentences.chinese: 那一对铜墨水池在座窝里跳起了舞。

sentences.english: Hong Hao, director of the Bureau of Shanghai World Expo Coordination, welcomed the delegation.
sentences.chinese: 上海世博局副局长陈先进会谈时在座。

sentences.english: Do you have any carbon paper anyone, here in your room?
sentences.chinese: 在座的各位，谁现在家里还有复写纸的？

sentences.english: His power was so great that the people present had to swallow their anger.
sentences.chinese: 他炽灼的气焰让在座的人敢怒而不敢言。

sentences.english: The students in the crowd nodded enthusiastically.
sentences.chinese: 在座的有些学生充满激情的点着头。

sentences.english: Why was Mr. Thomas's son, here, shot in a gambling house?
sentences.chinese: 为什么在座的托马斯先生的儿子在赌场上吃了枪子儿？

sentences.english: All of us were sent to Washington to carry out the people's business.
sentences.chinese: 我们在座的各位受命来到华盛顿都是要为民服务。

definition: to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
to attend a meeting as a nonvoting delegate
to raise a hand/to put up one's hand (as signal)
to question/to ask/to raise a question
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
